title: Did Neanderthals have religious beliefs?
summary: Whether Neanderthals had religious beliefs is a subject of ongoing debate.

title: Canon 8x20 IS binocular review
summary: These compact binoculars are a must-have for any wildlife enthusiast, being Canon's lightest binos with image stabilization.

title: The Climate Impact of Owning a Dog
summary: My dog contributes to climate change. I love him anyway.

title: لا للجمـود ولا للجحـود
summary: بلعوني قال إن هناك طريقا ثالثا رسمه علال الفاسي في صورة المحافظ المصلح الحداثي أعاد مصطفى بلعوني، أستاذ العلوم الاجتماعية والتاريخ الاجتماعي المعاصر، اكتشاف المخارج المغربية من متاهة صراع الحداثة والتقليد منذ عهد الحماية، في إشارة إلى الطريق الثالث الذي جسده علال الفاسي، باعتباره مفكرا محافظا مصلحا…
body: بلعوني قال إن هناك طريقا ثالثا رسمه علال الفاسي في صورة المحافظ المصلح الحداثي أعاد مصطفى بلعوني، أستاذ العلوم الاجتماعية والتاريخ الاجتماعي المعاصر، اكتشاف المخارج المغربية من متاهة صراع الحداثة والتقليد منذ عهد الحماية، في إشارة إلى الطريق الثالث الذي جسده علال الفاسي، باعتباره مفكرا محافظا مصلحا أكمل القراءة » المقالة لا للجمـود ولا للجحـود fمنشورة على جريدة الصباح .

title: Scientists find rare tusked whale alive at sea for the first time — and shoot it with a crossbow
summary: Researchers have identified ginkgo-toothed beaked whales alive at sea for the first time after years of searching, and in doing so solved the mystery of an odd echolocation pulse in the North Pacific.

title: A looming 'insect apocalypse' could endanger global food supplies. Can we stop it before it's too late?
summary: Insect populations are in steep decline, which could endanger the food supply. But there are things we can do to reverse the trend.

title: Mysterious galaxy trapped in 'the void' keeps churning out stars without fuel. Scientists are stumped.
summary: Researchers are puzzled as to how the dwarf galaxy NGC 6789 continues to make new stars, despite being stuck in the gas-famished Local Void.

title: How to see a rare conjunction of Mercury and Venus this month
summary: The inner planets Mercury and Venus will both be visible in the east-southeast sky before sunrise on Tuesday, Nov. 25.

title: Scientists discover new type of lion roar
summary: Researchers used artificial intelligence to analyze more than 3,000 recordings of African lions and found that the animals have an "intermediate" roar as well as a "full-throated" roar.

title: Archaeologists discover decapitated head the Romans used as a warning to the Celts
summary: A lone skull discovered near the walls of an ancient fort highlights the Romans' brutal treatment of their conquered foes.

title: Scientists put moss on the outside of the International Space Station for 9 months — then kept it growing back on Earth
summary: A species of moss survived for 9 months on the outside of the International Space Station, new research reveals — and 80% of the samples kept reproducing when returned to Earth.

title: Canon 12x36 IS III binocular review
summary: The ideal binocular for birdwatching — the Canon 12x36 IS III binoculars are a dream.

title: '3I/ATLAS is a comet': NASA finally releases new 3I/ATLAS images and addresses alien rumors
summary: NASA's highly anticipated comet 3I/ATLAS images have been released, with a space agency official shooting down alien rumors and stressing that the interstellar visitor is a comet.

title: Death Valley shrub rearranges its insides to thrive in one of the hottest places on Earth
summary: Heat-loving plants that thrive in California's Death Valley could hold the key to growing crops in a changing climate.

title: Science history: Experiment shows mutations arise spontaneously, supporting pillar of Darwinian evolution — Nov. 20, 1943
summary: Two bacteriologists showed that mutations arise spontaneously in bacterial cultures, thereby disproving Jean-Baptiste Lamarck's theory of evolution.

title: Kissing goes back 21 million years, to the common ancestor of humans and other large apes, study finds
summary: Scientists traced kissing back to a primate ancestor that lived around 21 million years ago.

title: Medieval spear pulled from Polish lake may have belonged to prince or nobleman
summary: Four medieval spearheads have been found in Lake Lednica in Poland. One may have belonged to a nobleman or prince.

title: Extreme bloom of toxic algae swirls in Nevada's 'Pyramid Lake' — Earth from space
summary: A 2024 satellite photo shows an unusually active bloom of toxic cyanobacteria swirling in the water of Nevada's Pyramid Lake. Research suggests that the algae has been blooming there for at least 9,000 years.

title: 'Sophisticated' Bronze Age city unearthed in Kazakhstan 'transforms our understanding of steppe societies'
summary: Archaeologists in Kazakhstan have discovered the "City of Seven Ravines," a vast Bronze Age "proto-city" with metalworking, dwellings and a large building.

title: ماذا قال توم كروز عند تسلمة أول أوسكار في مسيرته الفنية؟
summary: أشاد النجم الأميركي توم كروز بتأثير السينما وقدرتها على تغيير حياة الناس، وذلك خلال تسلمه جائزة أوسكار فخرية في حفل نظمته أكاديمية فنون وعلوم الصور المتحركة في لوس أنجلوس، حيث احتفت هوليوود بمسيرته الممتدة لأكثر من 45 عاماً وبإسهاماته في صناعة السينما.

title: Mars orbiter narrows down the exact path of interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS by 'ten-fold,' surprising scientists
summary: Scientists from the European Space Agency have significantly narrowed down the trajectory of the interstellar visitor 3I/ATLAS thanks to data from the alien comet's recent flyby of Mars, allowing for more accurate future observations.

title: 'Nothing but a nightmare': Worker ants are tricked into murdering their mom by an imposter queen — who quickly takes the throne for herself
summary: A sneaky spray of chemicals makes ant workers turn on their own mother — the queen — so a parasitic invader can take over the colony herself.
